intro: Lavoisiera linifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
